result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Deshea Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Count three.
Counts five and nine.

Defendant Gerald Deshea Anderson in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Gerald Deshea Anderson in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. PSI reviewed. Statements by parties, Tonya P., and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 3 AMENDED
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 8 YEARS, consecutive to counts 5 and 9 amended, with credit for 147 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 5 AMENDED
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, which can be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System.

AS TO COUNT 9 AMENDED
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, which can be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Tonya P unless approved by the agent.
-Maintain work, school, or a combination of both.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Gerald Deshea Anderson in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Gerald Deshea Anderson in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, AND 9
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered the Repeater Enhancer DISMISSED on all counts. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 4, 6, 7, AND 8 AMENDED
Pursuant to plea negotiations, upon motion of the state, court ordered Counts 1, 2, 4, 6, 7, and 8 Dismissed, But Read In. 

AS TO COUNTS 3, 5, AND 9 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, Jury Instructions, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

PSI ordered WITH RECOMMENDATION.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.
